definition[0]: a machine that has been sent into space and goes around the Earth, Moon etc, used for radio, television, and other electronic communication
example[0]: the launch of a communications and weather satellite
example[1]: This broadcast comes live via satellite from New York.
definition[1]: a natural object that moves around a planet
example[2]: The Moon is a satellite of the Earth.
definition[2]: a country, area, or organization that is controlled by or is dependent on another larger one
example[3]: the former Soviet satellite country of Lithuania
definition[3]: a town that has developed next to a large city
example[4]: We stayed in Aurora, a satellite suburb of Chicago.
definition[4]: a machine that has been sent into space and goes around the Earth, used for radio, television, and other electronic communication
example[6]: They provide news and live sporting events by satellite.
example[7]: Shares in satellite TV companies fell yesterday to an all-time low.
definition[5]: a country or organization that is controlled by or is dependent on another larger one
example[8]: the dissolution of the former Soviet Empire and the liberation of its satellites in Eastern Europe
